description: Commissioned and executed in the mid-14th century, this lengthy horizontal scroll illustrates the founding of the Yūzū Nembutsu sect of Japanese Buddhism. Yūzū Nembutsu means “chanting [Amida’s] name in communion”—a reference to the belief that one person chanting the Amida Buddha’s name would affect all other beings, whether in attaining individual rebirth or allowing souls in hell to be saved.
title: Legends of the Yūzū Nembutsu Sect
